availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Parker (Union County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Maryland native. Married to Elizabeth Parker. Father of Mary Parker, S. C. Parker, and Martha A. Parker. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Elected Sheriff of the Union County Court in 1854. Unsuccessful Know Nothing candidate for sheriff of the Union County Court in 1856. Unsuccessful Know Nothing candidate for sheriff of the Union County court in 1858. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Elected Sheriff of the Union County Court as a Unionist in 1862.

ab.bibl:
